trans-unit.source: Manage corporate-owned devices | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Manage corporate-owned devices | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Bring corporate-owned devices (COD) into management in a variety of ways depending upon the device, how it was purchased, and organization needs.
trans-unit.target: Bring corporate-owned devices (COD) into management in a variety of ways depending upon the device, how it was purchased, and organization needs.

trans-unit.source: Enroll corporate-owned devices with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Enroll corporate-owned devices with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Organization or corporate-owned devices (COD) can be brought into management by Intune in a variety of ways depending upon the device, how it was purchased, and the needs of the organization.
trans-unit.target: Organization or corporate-owned devices (COD) can be brought into management by Intune in a variety of ways depending upon the device, how it was purchased, and the needs of the organization.

trans-unit.source: Corporate-owned devices can also be enrolled and managed by installing the Company Portal app as in "bring your own device" (BYOD) scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Corporate-owned devices can also be enrolled and managed by installing the Company Portal app as in "bring your own device" (BYOD) scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Corporate-owned iOS devices
trans-unit.target: Corporate-owned iOS devices

trans-unit.source: These enrollment methods are good for "Choose your own device" (CYOD) scenarios where the organization purchases the devices for users, but wants to retain management of the device.
trans-unit.target: These enrollment methods are good for "Choose your own device" (CYOD) scenarios where the organization purchases the devices for users, but wants to retain management of the device.

trans-unit.source: If your organization has purchased iOS devices, you can pre-configure enrollment so that the device is managed from the first time its user turns it on.
trans-unit.target: If your organization has purchased iOS devices, you can pre-configure enrollment so that the device is managed from the first time its user turns it on.

trans-unit.source: Intune supports enrollment via [Apple's Device Enrollment Program (DEP)](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune.md) or using the Apple Configurator tool running on a Mac computer for [direct](ios-direct-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md) or [Setup Assistant](ios-setup-assistant-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md) enrollment.
trans-unit.target: Intune supports enrollment via [Apple's Device Enrollment Program (DEP)](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune.md) or using the Apple Configurator tool running on a Mac computer for [direct](ios-direct-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md) or [Setup Assistant](ios-setup-assistant-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md) enrollment.

trans-unit.source: [Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Enroll corporate-owned iOS devices](enroll-corporate-owned-ios-devices-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: Device enrollment manager
trans-unit.target: Device enrollment manager

trans-unit.source: Organizations can use Intune to manage large numbers of mobile devices with a single user account called a device enrollment manager account.
trans-unit.target: Organizations can use Intune to manage large numbers of mobile devices with a single user account called a device enrollment manager account.

trans-unit.source: After creating a device enrollment manager account, that account can be used by a manager to enroll more than the standard five devices allowed by default to normal users.
trans-unit.target: After creating a device enrollment manager account, that account can be used by a manager to enroll more than the standard five devices allowed by default to normal users.

trans-unit.source: Enrolling devices with a device enrollment manager only works for devices that aren't used by a specific user.
trans-unit.target: Enrolling devices with a device enrollment manager only works for devices that aren't used by a specific user.

trans-unit.source: These devices are good for point-of-sale or utility apps, for example, but bad for users who need access to email or company resources.
trans-unit.target: These devices are good for point-of-sale or utility apps, for example, but bad for users who need access to email or company resources.

trans-unit.source: [Enroll corporate-owned devices with the device enrollment manager](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Enroll corporate-owned devices with the device enrollment manager](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: Enroll corporate-owned Windows 10 desktops
trans-unit.target: Enroll corporate-owned Windows 10 desktops

trans-unit.source: If your organization has Azure Active Directory Premium (AADP) or Enterprise Management Suite (EMS), you can [enroll Windows 10 for enterprise](https://docs.microsoft.com/active-directory/active-directory-azureadjoin-windows10-devices-overview) and they will be automatically tagged as "corporate-owned" when users add their work or school account.
trans-unit.target: If your organization has Azure Active Directory Premium (AADP) or Enterprise Management Suite (EMS), you can [enroll Windows 10 for enterprise](https://docs.microsoft.com/active-directory/active-directory-azureadjoin-windows10-devices-overview) and they will be automatically tagged as "corporate-owned" when users add their work or school account.

trans-unit.source: Identify devices as corporate-owned
trans-unit.target: Identify devices as corporate-owned

trans-unit.source: Corporate-owned devices are listed as **Corporate** under **Ownership** in lists of devices.
trans-unit.target: Corporate-owned devices are listed as **Corporate** under **Ownership** in lists of devices.

trans-unit.source: Devices can be identified as corporate-owned in the following ways:
trans-unit.target: Devices can be identified as corporate-owned in the following ways:

trans-unit.source: [Enrolled with device enrollment manager (DEM)](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Enrolled with device enrollment manager (DEM)](enroll-corporate-owned-devices-with-the-device-enrollment-manager-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: Enrolled with Apple's [device enrollment program (DEP)](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune.md) or [Apple Configurator](ios-setup-assistant-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: Enrolled with Apple's [device enrollment program (DEP)](ios-device-enrollment-program-in-microsoft-intune.md) or [Apple Configurator](ios-setup-assistant-enrollment-in-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Predeclare devices with IMEI numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md)
trans-unit.target: [Predeclare devices with IMEI numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md)

trans-unit.source: [Azure Active Directory/Enterprise Management Suite registration of Windows 10 devices](https://docs.microsoft.com/active-directory/active-directory-azureadjoin-windows10-devices-overview)
trans-unit.target: [Azure Active Directory/Enterprise Management Suite registration of Windows 10 devices](https://docs.microsoft.com/active-directory/active-directory-azureadjoin-windows10-devices-overview)

trans-unit.source: International mobile equipment identity (IMEI)
trans-unit.target: International mobile equipment identity (IMEI)

trans-unit.source: Unique international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers are a common device property for many mobile device manufacturers.
trans-unit.target: Unique international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers are a common device property for many mobile device manufacturers.

trans-unit.source: Intune administrators can import IMEI numbers for devices the company owns.
trans-unit.target: Intune administrators can import IMEI numbers for devices the company owns.

trans-unit.source: When the device becomes managed by Intune, it is tagged as a corporate-owned device.
trans-unit.target: When the device becomes managed by Intune, it is tagged as a corporate-owned device.

trans-unit.source: [Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md)
trans-unit.target: [Specify corporate-owned devices with international mobile equipment identity (IMEI) numbers](specify-corporate-owned-devices-with-international-mobile-equipment-identity-imei-numbers.md)
